page.title: 05EAST GRINSTEAD THE PEOPLE
page.content: The town is now almost completely surrounded by modern housing estates, some still being completed. The houses are new, bright, varied and expensive and to some extent this characterises the people in them. They tend to be young and mobile, both in terms of transport and domicile. They tend to be bright and varied in occupation and background. They also tend to be middle class, conventional and conservative with an above average income. East Grinstead is little troubled by the industrial & social problems of other parts of the country and this is reflected in the prevalent political attitudes . Some of the tradition folk remain: Sussex people with roots in the area nd more working class atitudes. Many have lived in their Victorian houses all their lives , others live in the farms & cottages.
